data.title: Above and Beyond
data.text:
The hotel has a great location close to the BART station and the freeways.  Plenty of dining options around the area.  The remodeled rooms are very nice.  Great concierge lounge.  Highly recommend!

Want to give a special thanks to Haas Malik.  He helped me out with a back-up at the valet desk!  Very nice gesture for a Platinum Elite member.  Thanks Haas!

data.title: Staff Make the Difference!
data.text: Checked in one evening for a one night stay on a girls' get-away. The front desk personnel were some of the friendliest and most helpful I have ever encountered. They informed us of all the hotel's amenities and took the time to make sure we had everything we needed. The bellman was polite and helpful as well. We were upgraded to the Conceirge Floor which included some food and drink items. While we did not avail ourselves of this upgrade, what a nice surprise! We were so impressed  that the hotel had a shuttle and we happily used it to get downtown for dinner. There was also a nice bar and restaurant in the lobby. The room decor was very modern and clean. The only negative was the way the room window faced the inside. When the curtains were opened , the view was of the hotel's interior. This made for a dark room, which may not be ideal for those who love sunshine! All in all....easy location to find, and close to everything.

data.title: Valet service
data.text: RJ was very professional, helpful and efficient with valet service. We called before checking out for both of our vehicles. RJ was very attentive to our children and baggage. He was personal amidst the busy morning. We did not feel like a number.

data.title: Great place to stay
data.text: From out of state and stayed here three nights during the week.  Very convenient location - close to shopping, restaurants and BART.  Even though the hotel is right next to the freeway, the rooms were very quiet.  Dark remodel décor but nicely done and modern.  All hotel staff very friendly, including housekeeping and valet.  Took advantage of the free hotel shuttle service one night which takes you anywhere within a 3-mile radius.  Felt pampered at this hotel!

data.title: Private place for nursing or pumping
data.text: I'm at an all day meeting at the hotel and asked for a private place to pump. I was directed to the gym. Seriously??? I don't need a nice place or one of their hotel rooms but I don't think being offered the gym as a place to pump or nurse is acceptable. Neither is the public bathroom which probably would've been the next place they would have recommended! I just need a private place because I'm sure no one else wants to watch me pump! If you're going to have meetings at your hotel you should be able to accommodate your guests and meeting attendees!

owner_response.author: Nicole P, Manager at Walnut Creek Marriott, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your honest comments with us. I apologize for the inconvenience you encountered, and want you to know that this is not the level of hospitality that our guests have come to expect at our Walnut Creek Marriott. Please know that your review is now with our leadership team to help us make improvements for future hotel and meeting guests. Please feel free to reach out directly to our General Manager Eddie Adair atedward.adair@marriottwc.com or 317-965-0400 to further discuss your experience. Our team hopes that you enjoyed our meeting space, and that we have an opportunity to welcome you back soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendly staff, dark remodel
data.text:
Friendly staff at check in and in the concierge lounge. Very clean room with refrigerator and coffee amenities. Took me a bit, but I got used to the traffic and Bart noise. Paid a high price for a standard room due to a last minute change. Appears to be no consideration for that. 
Rooms were remodeled recently in all dark colors with dim lighting. Dark wood, walls painted brown, dark curtains. Had to feel around for light switches. Cave-like. Floors were dark wood laminate of some type, no carpeting. 
For Celiacs- concierge lounge appetizers were deep fried foods and pasta. Only fruit and veggies were gluten free. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, so there was a good option. 
I'd recommend staying in San Francisco and jumping on Bart in the morning if you can get a better price.

owner_response.author: Nicole P, Manager at Walnut Creek Marriott, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi passingthrough95, thank you for sharing your honest comments with us. I am pleased to hear that our team showcased our enthusiasm and commitment to providing excellent customer service. Please know that your thoughts are currently with our leadership team, as it is reviews like yours that enable us to make improvements to our concierge lounge offerings. We also appreciate your constructive feedback on our redesigned guest rooms as our renovation project was just completed. 
Please feel free to reach out directly to our General Manager Eddie Adair at edward.adair@marriottwc.com or 317-965-0400 to further discuss your experience. We do hope that you had a chance to take our complimentary shuttle to downtown Walnut Creek or the BART to discover the local gems of the East Bay Area. We hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back as our team would be eager to provide you with the experience all guests deserve and place you in a quieter guest room.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: My stay
data.text: I am out here for my grandmother's funeral  and stayed at the Marriott in Walnut creek. Farzy was a tremendous help as we wanted to go out to eat. We went to roundtable pizza just outside of walnut creek and the best pizza we have ever had. Thank you Farzy for making us feel welcome

data.title: Under construction
data.text: The check in process was excellent via Hollis.  The concierge lounge offerings are quite nice.  The rooms are a bit under-done with a lot of space and not much furniture.  Some rooms are under construction and ours appeared to be unfinished.  The bathroom is small and needs a re-do as the shower door metal is corroded.  A mixed bag but mostly positive due to good service.

data.title: A very nice business hotel, with staff who care even about convention-goers
data.text:
Even in an ordinary travel context (business or personal), my experience this weekend at the Walnut Creek Marriott was really nice. The modernized rooms with USB outlets and adequate regular outlets were a relief, and the staff were exceptional. Both the front desk and the valet/bell/shuttle staff deserve specific metion, they were attentive and mindful of my time.

On top of all that, this was a game convention, not a regular trip. Even the other hotels that host game conventions around the Bay Area tend to slack off and treat the convention much more poorly than other guests at other times. I was very happy to see that this hotel was different - I felt just as welcome and just as important to them as if I was a business traveller.

Thank you, Marriott Walnut Creek.

data.title: A Grand Time
data.text: It was a very fantastic stay, the hotel was a suggestion to stay in the upper Oakland area, and we had a great time for my moms birthday excursion to the San Fransisco area. The arrival drive up area could be better designed , but the meeting rooms and other areas of the facility are top notch.

data.title: There are many reasons we return
data.text: The staff and their welcoming attitude makes one feel at home as much as one can be traveling to another city.  Upon check in their night supervisor Brian made sure we would be comfortable and made every accommodation to make us happy.  Sudi, their hostess in their lobby restaurant is more than pleasant and personable.  She greets you with a sincere smile and remembers you as a past guest and always asks about family.  Wendy in their concierge lounge greets you by name and goes out of her way to make sure you have a pleasant stay while with her and her team.  The hotel was recently renovated and looks and feels great.  We visit family here in Walnut Creek and stay at this Marriott for two weeks at a time, and it's always very pleasant.

data.title: Far Exceeded my Expectations! Very Impressed!
data.text:
Wow--From check in to check out, Walnut Creek far exceeded my expectations. The staff was attentive, professional and just darn nice! Every. Single. One of them! 
Every issue I had (although not many) was rectified immediately and with friendly service. I never once felt like I was a waste of time--every staff member treated me with the utmost respect--very impressive!

The food was fantastic in the area downstairs. Loved the flavored water in the lobby. 

The shuttle into town is a plus--my colleagues and I used it several times and the guys driving were very helpful. 

I am not fond of the "remodeling" to hard wood floors in the rooms. I understand it is easier upkeep, but it makes it a little to "cold" for my taste. Although it appeared that the floors were heated. Because they were never actually "cold"?  However, I did love the décor! The bed was Marriott quality--perfection.

The only issue I could complain about was the coffee--it was terrible. But I am from the Pacific Northwest, so I am a coffee snob (lol)

I really liked this hotel and will use it again when flying in for business!

data.title: Business Meeting Support
data.text: I wanted to recognize a front desk associate named KAT for the excellent support she provided to me while I was staying at the Marriott on business. I was late for a business meeting in Sacramento and needed support printing and packaging documents from the business center before I left at 9am. I did not have time to go to Kinkos, or go back to the office before my meeting, so I asked KAT if she would be willing to help me out. Not only did she offer a hand in terms of printing, packaging and stapling my documents, she continued to do it with a smile, all during the time she was fielding phone calls from guests and handling other people checking in/out. I wanted to say that as a result of this VIP treatment I received while at your hotel, you can count on my coming back to stay while I am in SF on business. Thanks again, Ron Goodman

data.title: Noisy room
data.text: Nice hotel, clean, excellent service.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. But the walls are too thin!  I heard too much from my neighbor. The location is centrally located and near the freeway which is good.  No restaurants nearby however.  the only real food option is in the lobby which is ok.

owner_response.author: Nicole P, Manager at Walnut Creek Marriott, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Chris N, thank you for sharing your honest thoughts with us. I am glad to hear that our team showcased our commitment to providing exceptional customer service and overall guest experience to you. Please know that our staff would always be more than happy to locate you to a quieter room next time you stay with us. Additionally, we do provide a complimentary area shuttle to downtown Walnut Creek, which is perfect for taking advantage of and discovering local fare. On behalf of our team, we thank you for choosing to staying with us, and we hope that we have the opportunity to welcome you back to the East Bay Area soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Classy Marriot property
data.text: This was a quick stop for us but enjoyed our stay nonetheless.   Updated rooms and well appointed all the way around.  This is a hotel where you feel comfortable hanging around the lobby too with a great open and airy feel to it.   Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and really soak in the local area and enjoy the amenities it has to offer.

data.title: Front desk is amazing, housekeeping needs work
data.text:
We stayed here with a party of 10 people 2 weeks ago and while we encountered a challenging start to the stay, the front desk, particularly well-dressed Quentin and team, were very accommodating and tried to resolve all of the issues that we were facing. 

The only area that requires a significant amount of improvement is the housekeeping as we encountered multiple issues during our 4 day stay.

Without the efforts from Quentin and the front desk team, I would have immediately pushed for a cancellation of our corporate contract with the hotel, but am glad to say that they managed to save the day with their efforts and professionalism!

data.title: great location
data.text:
The hotel is in a very nice, easily accessible location.  The rooms have been upgraded, however the tile in the bathroom was old and cracked in a couple of areas.  The quality of the towels was inconsistent with some very soft and others quite stiff.  Housekeeping left a rag on top of the bathroom sink, it was clean, but did not look good.
Front desk employees were friendly and valet parking attendants were courteous.  The cost for valet parking was $23.00 per night, although the website said it was $15.00.  I told the front desk attendant that and she made the adjustment for 3 nights.
There is coffee in the room, but the coffee pot and cups, sugar etc., are in a drawer, therefore unless told where they are one can assume there is non.  Starbucks coffee in the lobby is good, but they offer only Pike's.

data.title: Great location and the Hotel is very nice
data.text: We were only here for 1 night.  The one thing I did NOT like was they have to park your car and you can not park it yourself.  I am sure it is because they have limited space.  They also charge you $23.00 per night.  They hotel has every thing you could ever want or  need.  It is in a good location.  Our room was a little different.  It was shaped like a Triangle.  That was OK and we over faced the freeway and that was ok.  The lighting wasn't that great and the walls were painted a dark color.  I was hard to find thing with the poor lighting and dark paint on the walls. It was very clean and the staff were all fantastic.

data.title: Great place to stay for S.F. visit
data.text: The friendly staff will shuttle you to the Bart, 5 minutes away, for a day site seeing in San Francisco. They will pick you up and bring you back to the hotel when you are done. We saw a different jazz group in their lounge on recent Friday and Saturday nights.The rooms are comfortable, attractive and reasonably priced. Their breakfast buffet is good but pricey. Their workout room is adaquate but hard to find and access.

data.title: Great staff. Breakfast was a hit.
data.text:
Check in was easy. Kat was very nice and knew about the local restaurants. Her absolute fav is Havana. Great suggestion. Went for a weekend getaway with the hubby and were given a nice higher floor room. Not an amazing view but the room was nice. Modern and sleek. 

Glad we stayed here. It was nice to get away for a few days.
